alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 2:28PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wayne, southern Pulaski and south central Rockcastle Counties through 315 PM EST... At 228 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Steubenville, or near Monticello, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Frazer, Quinton and Kidder around 240 PM EST. Burnside, Bronston, General Burnside S.P., Tateville, Elihu, Somerset Pulaski Airport and Sloans Valley around 245 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Somerset, Ruth, Grade, Dykes, Bent, Mount Victory, Shopville, Billows and Bloss. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for south central Kentucky.
